skill.author: DMJGilbert

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation/protocol skill with no executable code. It contains only guidelines for when to trigger deep reasoning mode. No scripts, network access, file access, or command execution capabilities were found. The skill is safe for production use.

content.user_title: Trigger Deep Analysis for Complex Problems Automatically
content.value_statement: Complex problems require deeper thinking to avoid costly mistakes. This skill automatically detects when to use maximum reasoning depth by evaluating complexity factors like architecture decisions, multi-file changes, and security implications.
actual_capabilities: Evaluates complexity across 8 indicators with weighted scoring system
Triggers deep reasoning when complexity reaches threshold of 5
Provides specific trigger phrases for manual activation
Tracks complexity factors like security, architecture, and performance
limitations: Does not automatically invoke ultrathink - requires manual trigger phrase
Complexity scoring must be calculated manually
Only provides guidelines - implementation depends on user's decision
Limited to defined complexity indicators - may not cover all scenarios

use_cases.title: Evaluate Technical Architecture Decisions
use_cases.description: Use before proposing system designs or architectural patterns to ensure thorough analysis of trade-offs and long-term implications.

use_cases.title: Debug Complex Issues After Failed Attempts
use_cases.description: Trigger after multiple failed debugging attempts to explore root causes, hidden assumptions, and unchecked possibilities.

use_cases.title: Analyze Security and Permission Systems
use_cases.description: Apply to authentication, authorization, and secret handling code to identify vulnerabilities and edge cases.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Complex Problem
prompt_templates.prompt: Think harder about this: Explain how the authentication flow works in this codebase.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: ultrathink: Evaluate microservices vs monolith for our e-commerce platform considering team size, scalability, and maintenance.

prompt_templates.title: Debugging Deadlock
prompt_templates.prompt: ultrathink: What are all possible root causes for this memory leak? What assumptions am I making? What have I not checked?

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Domain Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Take your time to deeply analyze: Design the data flow for our new real-time notification system across frontend, backend, and mobile apps.

output_examples.input: ultrathink: Evaluate these authentication approaches considering security, maintainability, and performance
output: - JWT tokens: Stateless, scalable, but revocation is complex. Risk if secret leaks.
- Session cookies: Easy to revoke, but server state required. CSRF protection needed.
- OAuth2: Industry standard, secure, but adds complexity and network calls.
- JWT requires careful key management and token renewal logic
- Sessions need database/storage and cleanup mechanisms
- OAuth2 involves multiple services and error handling paths
- JWT: Fast validation, no DB calls, but larger request sizes
- Sessions: DB lookup per request, can use cache optimization
- OAuth2: Network calls to auth server, creates dependency
Recommendation: Use JWT for API services, session cookies for web apps, OAuth2 for third-party integrations.

best_practices: Calculate complexity score before starting to determine if ultrathink is needed
Use specific trigger phrases consistently across your team for clarity
Recalculate complexity when scope changes mid-analysis to adjust depth
anti_patterns: Using ultrathink for simple, well-understood tasks wastes time and resources
Skipping ultrathink for complex problems often leads to incomplete solutions
Not adjusting complexity score when new factors emerge produces inadequate depth

faq.question: How does this integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: It provides guidelines and trigger phrases that work with Claude Code's /fix and /brainstorm commands for deeper analysis.

faq.question: What are the complexity limits?
faq.answer: No hard limit exists, but the scoring system helps determine when deep analysis is beneficial versus overkill.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my IDE?
faq.answer: No direct IDE integration. Use the trigger phrases manually when prompting Claude or Codex.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-only skill with no network, file, or external access capabilities.

faq.question: What if trigger phrases do not work?
faq.answer: Ensure you are using exact phrases like "ultrathink:" or "Think harder about this:" at the start of your prompt.

faq.question: How does this compare to normal Claude responses?
faq.answer: Ultrathink mode provides more thorough analysis with deeper exploration of edge cases and alternatives, taking more processing time.
